ResourceHeader.Description: The Casey Ionosonde station in Casey, Antarctica, has Ionosondes since July 1957. No ionosonde information between 07/1957 and 02/1993. There was a CADI between 02/1993 and 10/2001, and a IPS 5D since October 1999. The IPS 5D vertical sounding ionosondes normally sweep in frequency from about 1 to 21.5 MHz. Frequency step resolution for the 5D is 5kHz, with up to 4095 steps available. The step interval is variable, becoming more coarse at higher frequencies as ionograms are generally displayed on a logarithmic scale. See details at http://www.sws.bom.gov.au/World_Data_Centre/2/1/24
